subtitles.text: Hi, and welcome to Mia-Platform Video Pills.
In this video, we will see how we have improved the experience of connecting and editing a cluster within Mia-Platform Console.
From the homepage, you can click on the icons besides your platforms, or you can open the right menu and click on your companies to view all your platforms.
By clicking on one of the displayed platforms, you can access the cluster section to view all your connected clusters.
In this example, the platform doesn't have any connected cluster.
We can create a new cluster connection by clicking on the Add cluster connection button.
As you can see, we support by default all the major cloud providers like GCP, a AWS, Azure and Oracle Cloud.
You can also connect additional ones as long as they have a Kubernetes or OpenShift distribution.
Let's create a new cluster connection on GCP.
Let's select Kubernetes as a Runtime Service.
At this point, we should insert the cluster details.
So we add the cluster ID, the geographic location and a description.
Finally, we have to complete the connection by adding the cluster URL, the Proxy URL, a cluster token, and optionally an authority certificate.
This message confirms that that the cluster is finally connected.
As Mia-Platform supports multi-cloud environments, you can add another cluster from a different provider.
Let's click again on Add Cluster Connection.
Select “other” as cloud provider and Kubernetes is runtime service.
We now fill in the new cluster details.
Finally, we insert the cluster and proxy URL, The cluster token, and eventually the certificate of authority.
The new cluster is connected.
Within your environment.
You will find the two connected clusters with the details about the runtime services, the Kubernetes versions, and the cluster URL.
